conclusion: Objects A and B are cloths that will be placed down.
Objects C and D are a pink and brown block on the left.
Objects E and F are a green block and a smaller green block on the right.
When A and B are placed down, they will cover objects C, D, E, and F due to gravity.
The blocks (C, D, E, F) will not move or change position because they are stationary and heavy enough to resist displacement by the cloths.
The cloths will drape over the blocks, conforming to their shape due to gravity.
The cloths will hang down on the sides of the table.
The second image shows the cloths A and B placed on the table, draped over the blocks.
The final image shows the cloths hanging down from the table, indicating they have fully settled over the blocks.
When objects A and B are placed down, they will cover and hang over objects C, D, E, and F.
The cloths will drape over the blocks, and the blocks will remain in their initial positions.
